techmeme.title: TikTok launches TikTok Shop in Spain, letting creators sell products from beauty to home appliances, the first step of the feature's European rollout (Bloomberg)
TeamViewer says it plans to buy 1E, which makes automated remediation software, from Carlyle for $720M, closing in early 2025, its biggest ever acquisition (Aaron Kirchfeld/Bloomberg)
Microsoft unveils a new data center design that aims to use zero water, down from the 125M litres per year a typical center uses, rolling out since August 2024 (Dina Bass/Bloomberg)
Parents and school staff say student activity monitoring software that aims to intercept self-harm before it happens, while helpful, has unintended consequences (Ellen Barry/New York Times)
A profile of Vinted, a popular app in the EU for selling secondhand clothes that went from near collapse to a €5B valuation and plans to expand in the US (Trefor Moss/Wall Street Journal)
